Class Sales

java.lang.Object
Sales
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Sales>
public class Sales extends Object implements Comparable<Sales>
This java program defines a Sales class with different attributes corresponding to the information regarding a sale.
Author:
Mukesh Kumar Angrish The Sales class also has multiple accessors and mutators in order to provide flexibility during object creation and modification. There are also methods to convert object to string and to compare different Sales objects

    parameterized constructor that takes multiple attributes and called the corresponding mutators of the object

  • Constructor Details

    • Sales

      public Sales()
      default constructor that calls corresponding mutators of the object for different attributes with default values

    • Sales

      public Sales(String country, String item_type, char order_priority, Date order_date, long order_ID, Date ship_date, int units_sold, float unit_price, float unit_cost, double revenue, double total_cost, double total_profit)
      parameterized constructor that takes multiple attributes and called the corresponding mutators of the object
      Parameters:
      country - name of the country
      item_type - the type of the item in the sale
      order_priority - the priority of item order
      order_date - the date of order of the item
      order_ID - the unique id of the order
      ship_date - the shipping date of the order
      units_sold - number of units sold of the item
      unit_price - price of one unit of item
      unit_cost - cost of one unit of item
      revenue - revenue from the sale
      total_cost - total cost of the sale
      total_profit - total profit from the sale

    • Sales

      public Sales(Sales s)
      Copy constructor that takes a previously created Sales object as input and copies its attributes to the current Sales object
      Parameters:
      s - previously created Sales object
